text: Manticoceras is a genus of ammonites included in the family Gephuroceratidae. These fast-moving nektonic carnivores lived in the Devonian period, from 382.4 to 376.1 Ma. ==Species== * Manticoceras adorfense * Manticoceras contractum * Manticoceras drevermanni * Manticoceras intumescens * Manticoceras lamed * Manticoceras nodifer * Manticoceras simulator * Manticoceras sinuosum ==Distribution== Fossils of species within this genus have been found in the sediments of Germany, Australia, Canada, France, Poland, Spain, the United Kingdom and United States.Paleobiology Database ==References== Category:Ammonitida Category:Devonian ammonites Category:Ammonites of Asia Category:Ammonites of Europe Category:Ammonites of Australia Category:Ammonites of North America Category:Paleozoic life of Ontario
title: Manticoceras
